sources.data_found: Wulver cluster specifications: 25 GPU nodes, 128 cores per node; 4 NVIDIA A100 GPUs per node; 80 GB GPU memory per GPU. Also includes 100 general nodes, 2 large memory nodes, and 1 debug node.
Wulver cluster: 127 compute nodes total, each with two AMD EPYC 64-core processors and 512GB RAM. 25 nodes are enhanced with 4 NVIDIA A100 GPUs each. Total: 16256 CPUs with 68TB memory, 100 GPUs.
Kong cluster: Two nodes contain twin GPUs and 20 CPU cores each. Users can run jobs on two of the four GPUs simultaneously.
The Computer Science Department enrolls over 3,200 students at all levels across six programs of study. CS Department has 31 tenured/tenure track faculty.
BS Computer Science total enrollment 2024: 1,697 students (457 Freshman, 378 Sophomore, 513 Junior, 349 Senior). 259 Bachelor's degrees awarded in 2024.
Ying Wu College of Computing enrollment Fall 2023: 4,641 students (37% of NJIT total). YWCC graduates an average of 1,000 computing professionals per year.
Ying Wu College of Computing enrolls more than 4,000 students (close to 35% of NJIT's student body) and graduates more than 1,000 computing professionals every year.

In 2023, the most popular Masters Degree concentrations at NJIT were General Computer & Information Sciences (271 degrees awarded), Data Science, General (152 degrees), and Information Science (109 degrees). Total enrollment: 13,007 students.
Faculty size: 34 tenured or tenure-track faculty in Fall 2025. 23 Lecturers, 1 Professor of Practice. CS Department rankings and retention rates provided.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count (1,697) is directly from the BS Computer Science program page showing 2024 enrollment. Graduate CS count estimated from: CS Department has 3,200+ total students minus 1,697 undergrads = ~1,503 graduate students. With YWCC awarding 271 MS in Computer & Information Sciences degrees in 2023 (per DataUSA), and assuming average 2-year MS program duration, estimated MS CS enrollment ~542. PhD count estimated from remaining graduate students (1,503 - 542 = ~961) distributed across multiple programs; conservatively estimating ~303 PhD CS students based on typical program distributions and 5-6 year PhD duration.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Kong cluster has at least 2 nodes with twin GPUs (4 total K20Xm GPUs). These are older generation Tesla GPUs with compute capability 3.5.

gpu_resources.notes:
CLUSTERS INCLUDED + CALCULATIONS

1) Wulver (Main HPC cluster at NJIT): 25 GPU nodes × 4 A100 GPUs/node = 100 A100 GPUs. All specified as 80GB variant per the HPC documentation.

2) Kong cluster: Older cluster still in operation with Tesla K20Xm GPUs. Has 2 nodes with twin GPUs each = 4 GPUs total (not included in main counts as these are older generation).

3) Lochness and Stheno: Mentioned as additional clusters but no GPU specifications found in sources.

FINAL TOTALS:
- A100 80GB = 100 (all from Wulver cluster)
- All other requested GPU models = 0 (not found in sources)

Note: NJIT's primary GPU computing resource is the Wulver cluster with 100 NVIDIA A100 80GB GPUs, launched in partnership with DataBank.

analysis_notes: Data collected from multiple NJIT HPC documentation sources and official department pages. Student counts combine direct enrollment data (BS CS: 1,697) with estimates for graduate programs based on total CS department size (3,200+) and degree completion data.
